NAME.Nominative: Venerable Sylvester of the Caves of Kiev (12th C)

LIFE.Copyright: Bulgakov Handbook. Copyright 1997 by translator Fr. S. Janos.

SAINT.LIFE: The Monk Sylvester of Pechersk lived during the 12th century and was hegumen of the Mikhailovsk Vydubitsk monastery at Kiev. He continued the work of the monk chronicler Nestor and he wrote nine Lives of the Pechersk holy saints. In the service to the Pechersk Fathers venerated in the Nearer Caves, the Monk Sylvester is called blessed and endowed with “a miraculous gift to ward off demonic suggestions” (Ode9 of the Canon). The Monk Sylvester was buried in the Nearer Caves, and his memory is celebrated likewise on 28 September and on the 2<sup>nd</sup> Sunday of Great Lent.
